description:
Per the UN, in the first week of the military offensive in Ukraine, "more than a million refugees from Ukraine crossed borders into neighboring countries, and many more are on the move both inside and outside the country. They are in need of protection and support."

This market asks if there will be more than 5,000,000 Ukrainian Refugee arrivals between February 24, 2022 and April 30, 2022. If there are 5,000,001 or more Ukrainian refugees as measured by the resolution source by April 30, 2022, 8:00:00 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source to this market will be information provided by https://data2.unhcr.org/en/situations/ukraine. The number featured under the header "Refugee arrivals from Ukraine (since 24 February 2022)*", found in the top right of the resolution source page will be the primary source used to resolve this market.

If the resolution source URL changes, the new resolution URL will be used. If the resolution source is unavailable at the resolution time for this market, April 30, 2022, 8:00:00 PM ET, the resolution source will be checked every 12 hours - specifically, the .csv data will be totalled between February 24 and April 30, 2022, with the final check being on May 7, 2022, 8:00:00 PM ET. If the information remains unavailable at that time, this market will resolve 50-50.

markets.question: Will there be more than 5 million Ukrainian refugees by April 30, 2022?

title: Will there be more than 5 million Ukrainian refugees by April 30, 2022?
